alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 19 at 1:03PM PST until January 21 at 2:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 2 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with sets to 8 feet are expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 2 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Swell and surf will peak Saturday night. Largest surf will be on exposed, west-facing beaches.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions.hould remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
